The working tools of an Entered Ap - prentice are the Twenty-four Inck Gauge and the Common Gavel. The Twenty-four Inch Gauge is an instrument used by operative masons to measure and lay out their work; but we as Free and Accepted Masons, are taught to make use of it for the more noble and glorious purpose of dividing our time. It being divided into twenty-four equal parts, is emblematical of the twenty-four hours of the day, which we are taught to divide into three equal parts: where - by are found eight hours for the service FIRST DEGREE 7 of God, and a distressed worthy brother; eight for our usual vocations; and eight for refreshment and sleep. You were presented with a Lambskin or White Leather Apron because The Lamb in all ages has been deemed an emblem of innocence.
